greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Least k <= n such that n*tau(k) = k*tau(n), where tau(n) is the number of divisors of n (A000005).
link: Amiram Eldar, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
maple: for k from 1 to n do
mathematica: a[n_] := Module[{k = 1, r = DivisorSigma[0, n]/n}, While[DivisorSigma[0, k]/k != r, k++]; k]; Array[a, 100] (* _Amiram Eldar_, Aug 19 2019 *)
xref: Cf. A095300 for n such that a(n) < n.
results.author: _Amarnath Murthy_, May 30 2004
ext: Edited and extended by _Klaus Brockhaus_, Jun 01 2004
